p.codeblock: Future<void> enableMultiCamera( {required bool enabled, required CameraCapturerConfiguration config});
public abstract int EnableMultiCamera(bool enabled, CameraCapturerConfiguration config);

section.p:
In scenarios where video is already being captured by a camera, Agora recommends the following steps to implement multi-camera capture and video publishing:
Call this method to enable multi-camera capture.
Call to start local video preview.
Call and set sourceType to specify the second camera to start capturing.
Call and set publishSecondaryCameraTrack to to publish the video stream from the second camera in the channel. To disable multi-camera capture, refer to the following steps:
Call .
Call this method and set enabled to . This method is for iOS only.When using multi-camera video capture, ensure the system version is 13.0 or above.The minimum supported iOS device models for multi-camera capture are:
iPhone XR
iPhone XS
iPhone XS Max
iPad Pro (3rd generation and later)

In scenarios where a video is already being captured using a camera, Agora recommends the following steps to achieve multi-camera capture and publish video:
Call this method to enable multi-camera capture.
Call to start local video preview.
Call and set sourceType to specify the second camera for capture.
Call and set publishSecondaryCameraTrack to to publish the second camera's video stream in the channel. To disable multi-camera capture, refer to the following steps:
Call .
Call this method and set enabled to . This method is only applicable to iOS.When using multi-camera capture, ensure the system version is 13.0 or above.The minimum supported iOS device models for multi-camera capture are as follows:
iPhone XR
iPhone XS
iPhone XS Max
iPad Pro (3rd generation and later)

In scenarios where one camera is already capturing video, Agora recommends the following steps to enable multi-camera capture and publish video:
Call this method to enable multi-camera capture.
Call to start local video preview.
Call and set sourceType to specify the second camera for capture.
Call and set publishSecondaryCameraTrack to to publish the second cameraâ€™s video stream in the channel. To disable multi-camera capture:
Call .
Call this method and set enabled to . This method is for iOS only.When using multi-camera video capture, ensure the system version is 13.0 or later.The minimum supported iOS devices for multi-camera capture are:
iPhone XR
iPhone XS
iPhone XS Max
iPad Pro (3rd generation and above)
section.note:
You can call this method before or after to enable multi-camera capture:
If called before , the local video preview will display the images captured by both cameras.
If called after , the SDK will first stop the current camera capture, then start both the original and second cameras. The local video preview will briefly go black and then automatically recover.

You can call this method to enable multi-camera capture either before or after :
If called before , the local video preview will display feeds from both cameras simultaneously.
If called after , the SDK will stop the current camera capture first, then start both the original and the second camera. The local video preview may briefly go black before automatically recovering.

You can call this method before or after to enable multi-camera capture:
If called before , the local video preview shows feeds from both cameras simultaneously.
If called after , the SDK stops the current camera capture, then starts both the original and second camera. The preview may briefly go black before recovering automatically.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable multi-camera video capture mode:
: Enable multi-camera capture mode. The SDK uses multiple cameras to capture video.
: Disable multi-camera capture mode. The SDK uses only a single camera to capture video.
Capture configuration for the second camera. See .

Whether to enable multi-camera video capture mode:
: Enables multi-camera capture mode. The SDK uses multiple cameras to capture video.
: Disables multi-camera capture mode. The SDK uses only a single camera to capture video.
Configuration for the second camera. See .

Whether to enable multi-camera video capture mode:
: Enable multi-camera mode. The SDK uses multiple cameras to capture video.
: Disable multi-camera mode. The SDK uses only one camera to capture video.
Capture configuration for the second camera. See .

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
